snippet: In speaking to the N.C.A.A.P., Mitt Romney hopes his pro-jobs message will persuade some African-Americans.
abstract: Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney will speak to the NAACP, hoping his pro-jobs message will persuade some African-American voters; while blacks are expected to solidly back Pres Obama again in the election, he faces challenges in generating the same enthusiasm as in 2008.
lead_paragraph: In speaking to the N.C.A.A.P., Mitt Romney hopes his pro-jobs message will persuade some African-Americans.

headline.seo: Romney Courts Black Vote, an Obama Strength in ‘08
headline.main: Romney Makes a Push for Black Voters
headline.print_headline: Romney Makes a Push for Black Voters

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
